ai-patthana15.61:0.2_0: The Order of the Dhamma: allows unintelligent in the Khadehaka, that is to say, the Lord of the Death,
ai-patthana15.61:0.3_0: perhaps the three are worthy of burning, and comparing the skillful,
ai-patthana15.61:1.1_0: Pleasant is included in happiness, and skillful qualities. Nor do they give rise to the blameless state.
ai-patthana15.61:1.1_1: Not perceiving happiness as a skillful quality doesn’t give rise to bliss or unskillful.
ai-patthana15.61:1.1_2: Pleasant isn’t included in the happiness and skillful, nor unskillful qualities because of the skillful teaching.
ai-patthana15.61:1.1_4: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana15.61:2.1_0: By these things, their pleasure and happiness doesn’t give rise to the pleasure of bliss. Consciousness arises dependent on the teaching.
ai-patthana15.61:2.1_1: Not unskillful qualities arises in someone who has excessive pleasure and happiness, and doesn’t give rise to the unskillful.
ai-patthana15.61:2.1_2: Pleasant is not included in happiness and an unprofitable quality, and lacking anything unskillful.
ai-patthana15.61:2.1_4: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana15.61:2.1_5: What is an unshakable, in the three ways?
